result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Addison, Demario L

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demario L Addison in court with Attorney Kathleen Kruse as friend of court on this file.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken. Called @ 3:35 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for adjourned initial appearance on 22CF501 and 3rd status on 22CT194. Record by Attorney Kruse that Defendant is seeking private counsel on felony file. Asks that both matters be set out about 60 days. Court sets as requested.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Demario L Addison in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Attorney Kathryn Kruse appears as friend of the Court on new file 22CF501 and as attorney of record on 22CT194. Called @ 1:35 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF501, and 4th status on the 22CT194. Record by Atty. Kruse as to status of the CT fie and is set to resolve at next court date of October 27th. Further record as to new charges that she has not yet seen. Court goes over the charges and penalties in new file and sets this matter over to October 27th with CT file. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Demario L Addison in court. Attorney Andrew Herrmann appearing for the State of Wisconsin. Bond to cover all files. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
